summary: a major MERS outbreak in south Korea caused 186 cases and 36 deaths in 2015. a major MERS outbreak in south Korea caused 186 cases and 36 deaths. a serological and virological surveillance study was carried out in the camel herds of the alxa, bayan Nur, and Ordos areas of the IMAR from 26 July to 1 August 2015. we investigated five herds (80 camels sampled) in Alxa, three herds (60 camels sampled) in Bayan Nur, and two herds (50 camels sampled) in Ordos. sera 1/5 1 0.17 ND Post-immu; post-immu.sera, camel sera before rNDV-MERS-CoV-S immunization; post-immu.sera, rNDV-MERS-CoV-S-immunized camel sera; VNT, virus neutralization titer; negative for MERS-CoV RNA. pre-immunized camels had neutralization antibody titers against rVSVG/S-eGFP of less than 1:2. control serum from rNDV-MERS-CoV-S immunized camel yielded neutralization antibody titer of 1:512. an enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay was carried out to test for MERS-CoV-specific antibodies in serum samples. MERS-CoV infection should be confirmed through further surveillance studies.
